message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with complexity theory and circuit complexity, which are central topics in computer science. Specifically, it establishes a duality between depth-3 formulas and one-sided approximation by depth-2 formulas, which are both important concepts in circuit complexity. Therefore, cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves hypergraphs and extremal problems, which are related to discrete mathematics, so cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also uses information theory and probabilistic techniques, which are relevant to cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper deals with the size of formulas and circuits, which is related to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
